body_html:
Considering how one of the frequently mentioned advantages of TensorFlow Lite (interpreter) over XLA (compiler) is that you can update models without changing app code, I assume the intention is to require a file system.

Raspberry Pi seems to be on the roadmap though: #14589

Perhaps you could try to compile a frozen GraphDef with tfcompile (LLVM based) for your target though?
body_text:
Considering how one of the frequently mentioned advantages of TensorFlow Lite (interpreter) over XLA (compiler) is that you can update models without changing app code, I assume the intention is to require a file system.
Raspberry Pi seems to be on the roadmap though: #14589
Perhaps you could try to compile a frozen GraphDef with tfcompile (LLVM based) for your target though?
body:
Considering how one of the frequently mentioned advantages of TensorFlow Lite (interpreter) over XLA (compiler) is that you can update models without changing app code, I assume the intention is to require a file system.

Raspberry Pi seems to be on the roadmap though: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/14589

Perhaps you could try to compile a frozen GraphDef with tfcompile (LLVM based) for your target though?
